clinical_study.brief_title: Testing Numeric Formats for Presenting Data About Treatment Benefits and Harms
clinical_study.official_title: Testing Numeric Formats for Presenting Data About Treatment Benefits and Harms

lead_sponsor.agency: White River Junction Veterans Affairs Medical Center

collaborator.agency: Attorney General Consumer & Prescriber Education Grant

clinical_study.source: White River Junction Veterans Affairs Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test comprehension of five numeric formats used to present data about treatment benefits and harms.

primary_outcome.measure: Comprehension questions (e.g., overall direction of effect and specific numeric data)

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk perceptions (e.g., how big or small is the benefit)and preferences (e.g., did the box help subjects understand the benefits) assessed via Internet surveys.

arm_group.description: Numbers are presented in percentage format (e.g., 35%, 0.2%) only.
Numbers are presented in fixed frequency format only (5 out of 1000, 0.6 out of 1000). Denominators remains the same for each number.
Frequency denominators are adjusted to keep the numerator greater than 1, so they may change throughout the survey (e.g., 6 out of 1000, 42 out of 100)
Numbers are presented with both percentages and frequencies, and frequency denominators remain fixed (e.g., _ out of 1000).
Numbers are presented with both percentages and frequencies, but frequency denominators may vary (e.g., _ out of 1000, _ out of 100).

intervention.intervention_name: Presentation of drug efficacy and side effect data
intervention.description: Data presented in 1 of 5 numeric formats in each arm: percentage only, fixed frequency only, variable frequency, variable combination and fixed combination format.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
- Participants will be randomly selected from a research panel of more than 60,000 U.S. households (Knowledge Networks).
